reviews.text: Best chicken sandwich I ever had in my life friendly environment definitely a place to stop by if you are in. Brooklyn so not miss out!!!

I rarely leave reviews, but my family and I had such a disappointing experience at Underhill Cafe that I felt it was important to share. From the moment we arrived, no one acknowledged us no greeting, no welcome, nothing. We patiently waited to be seated, only to watch multiple parties who came in after us get seated and served right away.

It was disheartening and honestly infuriating to be treated as if we were invisible. We ultimately decided to leave and take our business elsewhere. I can‚Äôt say for certain if this was discriminatory, but it felt that way especially seeing white customers arrive later and receive immediate service.

No one should have to question whether they‚Äôre being treated differently because of who they are. Do better.
Excelled in food and atmosphere.

serious announcement: moussaka + lemon potatoes + fresh pita and dips + grilled chicken are divine! this neighborhood spot is owned and ran by a great family and has all the things i love. it's cozy and cute, TVs for the game, beers on tap‚Ä¶

Underhill Caf√© is an absolute gem! I had one of the juiciest burgers I‚Äôve ever tasted ‚Äî perfectly cooked and full of flavor. But what really surprised me was the avgolemono soup‚Ä¶ honestly, it was better than homemade! Creamy, tangy, and comforting ‚Äî just like something straight out of a Greek kitchen. The staff was friendly, the place cozy, and everything came out fresh. Definitely my new go-to spot!
A very cozy Greek spot. The food is great, and the owner is a very nice and funny guy. We got some free baklava for dessert, and the falafel here is the best I've ever tasted.

Great brunch options with lovely al fresco seating!
We thoroughly enjoyed our first visit here! The menu has something for everyone and I love that their brunch options come with coffee or tea + a brunch beverage (e.g., mimosa/bellini/sangria). We knew before even ordering that we‚Äôd be coming back again for dinner as there are so many dishes we want to try!
We enjoyed all of the following:
- Saganaki (The star of the show! Incredible, a must-try!)
- Lumberjack Breakfast with eggs over easy and sausage (sausage was only ok)
- Greek salad
- Eggs Benedict with prosciutto
A special thanks to Laura who took care of us, was so kind and attentive, and gave great recommendations!
Great food, great place and staff is so nice. I highly recommend it!

I chose the lamb burger because it had onions and garlic aioli. It came out too hot to eat, even as the fries were getting cold. As it cooled down, it was unfortunately no more appetizing than it looked. It was dry and salty. I don't know lamb enough to know if it was overcooked, but then I remembered the aioli. I had specifically ordered it for the garlic aioli, and I couldn't find it.

I asked the waitress, whose kind demeanor was the only nice part of the meal. She checked with the kitchen. They didn't have the aioli, so they had just left it off without saying anything.

The check came - they charged me $23.50 for an incomplete burger that wasn't tasty enough to finish. Then after I left the tip, they snuck on an additional 3% credit card fee.
Great food, good energy, will definitely return soon.
Such a friendly place! And the food was great. Get the Spanakopita for sure‚Äìit was delicious. Great neighborhood spot to hang out at.
Lovely restaurant on a lovely block. Wonderful owner. Definitely recommend anyone in the area to stop by.

For our Sunday lunch, we were seated quickly and our order arrived promptly. They had good vegetarian options on the menu, and the service was excellent. We especially appreciated the complimentary baklava at the end of our meal.

We enjoyed a delicious brunch here and this will certainly become one of our favorite local restaurants. We ordered the pork souvlaki platter and a special Chicken and potatoes. Both were hearty and flavorful, and reminded us of our time in Greece. They also offer Mythos beer, which was a pleasant surprise. Affordable pricing for the quality and quantity, and excellent service.
Grilled salmon was good.
First good burger I had in NYC in 2 years! Totally recommend üíØ

Charming Greek spot with a familiar face from downtown Brooklyn‚Äôs (now closed) Apollo diner.

Delicious food, chill vibes! Go for the tzatziki, stay for the gyro!
really great food and amazing service! will be coming back

What a charming Greek spot! We thoroughly enjoyed our meal here, opting for the **Gyro platter** and the **Grilled Salmon**, both of which were wonderfully fresh and wholesome. Beyond the delicious food, the restaurant had truly lovely vibes. To top it all off, they even gave us complimentary Baklava, which was such a delightful touch. Highly recommend!
great spot!
Best Gyro I‚Äôve ever had, owner was the nicest guy, free baklava
Great location, amazing food, even better service

Lovely little spot. I went for lunch on a hot weekend and it was so relaxing. I got the gyro and a peach juice. Delish! My gf got the Chicken and waffles. She liked that they don't skimp on the butter üòã
Best Greek food in NYC!!!

Tasty food and fair prices. I love the chicken souvlaki sandwich for lunch.

The owner and staff are lovely. So friendly and welcoming. I also like outdoor seating and plants.
Recommended. Home feeling, incredible food and great value for money ü§ç it‚Äôs a hidden gem üíé
Highly recommend, amazing fresh food and great service.

We live in the neighborhood and had been meaning to try Underhill Cafe for so long (everyone says such good things)! We finally got around to it yesterday and I‚Äôm so glad we did. The owner is an absolute gem (so kind!) and the food is great. I had the falafel platter (that dill sauce is unreal) and we shared a caesar salad (also great). The baklava at the end is really such a sweet (and delicious) touch. More than anything, the vibes are just right - relaxed, warm, and makes you feel at home. We‚Äôll be back!

Hidden gem in the neighborhood. Good food, great service, cute corner, nice outdoor seating. Reasonably priced. Easy going. Have a glass of wine and open your laptop to work if needed, or just people watch and bring your dog. Will definitely be back!
Ambiance of a family business! Welcoming and cozy.

Best in the area. The owner is one of the most special warm people you will
Meet. Thanks
Unarguably the best lamb doner I‚Äôve eaten in NYC. Lovely host!
Underhill Cafe is five-Star phenom.
The special chicken was very good and the waitress was very nice.
Very nice place with excellent food and location

The best Greek restaurant that I have been, the food is amazing and fresh!!! And also the attention, they are so nice.
And they have free nice baklava for dessert and it‚Äôs free!!!!!
Underhill‚Ä¶under rated!
Definitely worth your time to get some good food!
Everything tasted great. Go here and see order what looks good. You‚Äôll be happy you did.
Always a great choice! The food is delicious, and the attentive staff makes every meal enjoyable.

Gorgeous restaurant with dark wood and huge windows, amazing food, and absolutely S tier service. The owner and our server had great recommendations about the menu and were so friendly. Food is a mix of Greek and American diner vibes which is awesome.

Will definitely be back and highly recommend!
Lovely food and service
fantastic food and staff was so friendly! would come back for sure. I want to try the whole menu.
My new spot when I'm craving comforting foodü•∞
Came here looking for brunch , read the reviews online and they didn‚Äôt disappoint, the food was so good and fresh, will definitely be back such a chill/calm restaurant
Very nice place, good food!
This is our go to brunch spot. The food is fantastic and the service is great! 12/10 recommend.
The penne with meatballs was delicious and the service was amazing!
So delicious! And great service. Burger was amazing and best sweet potato fries ever.
Seamless take out experience

The owner, Isidoro, came to our table and took time to explain the dishes and made great suggestions. The fried feta with coating of honey was a great appetizer. We also ordered salmon and chicken gyros. I definitely recommend this restaurant for a taste of Greece.
The owner was very warm and welcoming, graciously accommodating our large group of six. We had a wonderful experience and enjoyed the food. The moussaka, spanakopita, and baklava were my favorites.

Came in here randomly one day for lunch and i walked away with a new fav in the area!! The owner is usually there and is so so so kind.

I keep it simple with the Prasini salad and it‚Äôs SO fresh and good. That salad comes with pita, so I order a side of the tzatziki sauce to dip.

Nothing but good things to say about this place ! I usually come alone with a book and it‚Äôs 10/10.
Great meal and service! Octopus, ribeye, and shrimp dishes were all phenomenal. Free baklava for dessert was a really nice touch. Looking forward to coming back and trying more!

Delivery came very quick. Ive been here a couple of times before and know the food is good. The spanakopita is outstanding. The lemon chicken is a large portion and delicious too. One recommendation is to ask them to wrap the container with‚Ä¶

First time here, we had a great experience. It doesn‚Äôt offer only Greek food, you can chose among many different dishes and the food is amazing. The owner was super nice, extremely kind and friendly.
We will come back for sure.

UPDATE June 2021:
I was so excited to get to actually eat at Underhill after enjoying their delivery food through Covid, but I have to say I was shocked to dine in and find the lamb burger was overcooked and dry, the fries seem to have changed, everything was just a bit bland etc. I‚Äôm not sure if there‚Äôs a new chef or just a very off night but it was super disappointing. My original review is below, so I am only writing this in the hopes someone at Underhill takes it to heart, as I know it‚Äôs such a great spot.

2020:
If you love Greek food, don‚Äôt miss this place! We have only had their delivery but it always comes quickly and the food is delicious. You HAVE to get the lamb burger ‚Äî non negotiable. It is so good with crispy cheese on the bottom. Mmm. The spanikopita was a bit soggy but flavor is great. We love this spot.

We shared the gyro platter with French fries. It's big enough for two to have a light lunch. The pita bread was fresh and amazing. The owner was so kind and gave us  complimentary baklava since it was our first visit. Also yum! We'll be back. Great neighborhood place.

We had lunchtime there, and it was really good. the service is great. The waiter was very kind to adapt some options to my wife diet. We order a portobello burger, sweet fried potatoes, and a meat burger. Everything was perfect and quick service. If you like coffee, you should order. It was pretty good also.

Loved it here! We came on valentine's day for the Prix Fixe menu which was $50 pp and we got 3 courses each and a bottle of pinot grigio. Bargain! Intimate seating area with a bar. The food was INCREDIBLE. We will definitely return.‚Ä¶

We had the soup special and the soup completely lacked flavor. The meatball dish was also meh it drowned in tomato sauce and felt very heavy. The dishes took a while to come out and the general vibe at the restaurant seemed like the‚Ä¶
Delicious Greek! So good! Nice creativity shown with the burger and really great vibes. Perfect for a nice summer evening for food and cocktails.

The best Greek restaurant in Brooklyn. I am particularly lucky to have them around the corner from me. I used to live near Taverna Kyclades and adored their food, but it has gone downhill. I no longer have to travel for excellent food!‚Ä¶

Came at off hours on a Sunday. Was welcomed with open arms and shown to a wonderful window table.  Owner was very friendly, made some great suggestions, and then served us freshly made authentic food. Try the Greek yogurt. Absolutely amazing!

We were very excited to try this place.  However, one of the staff‚Äîa older man was very rude.  My 2 year old was playing with his fork at the table and he came and grabbed his hand and disciplined my son, telling him not to do that.  Please do not discipline someone else‚Äôs kid and keep your hands to yourself.  If you have a problem with my son tell me about your issue,,but do not touch my 2 year old and grab his hand, that is not your place and it is not professional.
It ruined our time there and we asked for the check and left immediately.  The atmosphere was not welcoming.

Inside is open air when windows are opened. and plenty of shaded seating outside.

Delicious Greek salad (added grilled chicken).

What a great experience! Had dinner there the other night and food was fantastic. We had the spanakopita, pastichio, and pork souvlaki. Ended with unexpected baklava, which was out of this world! Very clean, service was excellent and the owner was very nice and friendly. Looking forward to our next meal at Underhill Cafe!

Quite possibly the best gyro I have ever had, amazing ceasar salad and absolutely perfectly crispy and delicious calamari.

Also very nice and attentive service with nice outfoor seating on a beautiful block.

I can‚Äôt recommend this place enough!

I came back from Greece the other week and was craving Greek food so decided to check this place out. I honestly could not taste the difference from here and the food in Athens, same quality couldn‚Äôt event tell you the difference, authentic as can be. Owner is also extremely nice.
Food was really, really good. Four of us came and we were impressed with everything we ordered. Owner/manager is an incredibly charismatic, kind and welcoming host. We will be back!
